reference: Volume One, Issue Four, Phile #2 of 11
title: Ringback Codes for the 314 NPA
historical_context: This article is part of the early hacking culture, focusing on telecommunication techniques used by phreakers in the 1980s.
target_audience: Phreakers, telecommunications enthusiasts, and hackers interested in phone system exploits.
short_summary: The article provides a list of ringback codes for the 314 area code, detailing how to use them to manipulate phone systems for testing or pranking purposes.
summary:
In this brief article, the author presents a collection of ringback codes specifically for the 314 area code, aimed at phreakers looking to experiment with telephone systems. The codes allow users to dial specific prefixes followed by their phone number to trigger a ringback tone, which can be used for various purposes, including testing line functionality or executing pranks. The instructions emphasize the need to flash the switch hook after dialing the code to initiate the ringback process.

The list includes a variety of codes, each associated with a specific prefix, showcasing the ingenuity of early hackers in manipulating telecommunication systems. This article serves as a practical guide for those interested in exploring the capabilities of phone networks during a time when such knowledge was not widely available, reflecting the underground culture of hacking and phreaking that characterized the era.
